channel.title: Moparscape's built-in server. {Question for Mopar, himself, perhaps?}
channel.description:
Hey, I got moparscape and its built in server working.
What I would like to know, is if there is a way to use another server with moparscape. (I.E. Replacing the /Hybridscape/ files with another server's files, and running it.)
Yes, I have tried doing that, it doesn't work so far..
Downloading another server and using it's run-server .bat isn't an option for me, I am on mac osx. (Yes, I've figured out how to run a server on mac, through mopar..)
Thanks! -Mop
Edit: If there is another way to run a server on Mac, that would work too.

item.title: Moparscape's built-in server. {Question for Mopar, himself, perhaps?}
item.dc:creator: @Oh_Noes_PIERATS Oh Noes! PIERATS!
item.description:
@Oh_Noes_PIERATS wrote:

Could be because its not meant for running on macs, just try and remove the code which makes that message be displayed.

Read full topic
item.source: Moparscape's built-in server. {Question for Mopar, himself, perhaps?}

item.title: Moparscape's built-in server. {Question for Mopar, himself, perhaps?}
item.dc:creator: @Moptop Moptop
item.description:
@Moptop wrote:

Ah, Ok.

Edit: Keep getting this -

Welcome to Darwin! Imac:~ Dave$ cd ~/Desktop/moparscape/hybridscape Imac:~/Desktop/moparscape/hybridscape Dave$ java server -cp / Starting Black-Scape on 0.0.0.0:43594 config\objects.cfg: file not found.

That line, I have tried every possible combination of the commands given by the .bat file, that I could think of.

And yes, config/objects.cfg is there.

Edit again: The server still works though. Is this another problem with the source that I should just ignore?

Edit yet again: The terminal gets swamped by “[KERNEL]: machine is too slow to run this server!” messages. But I am on a 1.8ghz computer, so I highly doubt that?

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape's built-in server. {Question for Mopar, himself, perhaps?}
item.dc:creator: @Moptop Moptop
item.description:
@Moptop wrote:

I tried to compile Deathscape, and got this:

Welcome to Darwin! Imac:~ Dave$ sh sh-2.05b$ cd ~/Desktop/deathscape sh-2.05b$ javac *.java NPC.java:41: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class NPC public void updateNPCMovement(stream str) { ^ NPC.java:64: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class NPC public void appendNPCUpdateBlock(stream str) { ^ NPC.java:122: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class NPC protected void appendHitUpdate(stream str) { ^ NPC.java:143: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class NPC protected void appendHitUpdate2(stream str) { ^ NPC.java:164: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class NPC public void appendAnimUpdate(stream str) { ^ NPC.java:169: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class NPC public void appendDirUpdate(stream str){ ^ NPC.java:173: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class NPC public void appendFaceToUpdate(stream str) { ^ Player.java:504: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player public void updateThisPlayerMovement(stream str) { ^ Player.java:576: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player public void updatePlayerMovement(stream str) { ^ Player.java:633: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player public void addNewNPC(NPC npc, stream str, stream updateBlock) ^ Player.java:633: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player public void addNewNPC(NPC npc, stream str, stream updateBlock) ^ Player.java:658: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player public void addNewPlayer(Player plr, stream str, stream updateBlock) { ^ Player.java:658: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player public void addNewPlayer(Player plr, stream str, stream updateBlock) { ^ Player.java:693: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player protected static stream playerProps; ^ Player.java:697: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player protected void appendPlayerAppearance(stream str) ^ Player.java:849: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player protected void appendPlayerChatText(stream str) { ^ Player.java:858: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player protected void appendUpdate1(stream str) { ^ Player.java:862: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player public void appendPlayerUpdateBlock(stream str) { ^ Player.java:1083: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player protected void appendHitUpdate2(stream str) { ^ Player.java:1107: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player protected void appendHitUpdate(stream str) { ^ Player.java:1151: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player public void appendAnimationRequest(stream str) ^ Player.java:1158: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player public void appendEmotionUpdate(stream str) { ^ Player.java:1164: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player public void appendMask1Update(stream str) { ^ Player.java:1174: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player public void appendFaceNPCUpdate(stream str) { ^ Player.java:1180: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player public void appendMask100Update(stream str) { ^ Player.java:1198: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player public void appendMask400Update(stream str) { // Xerozcheez: Something to do with direction ^ Player.java:1209: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player public void appendString4(stream str) { // Xerozcheez: Interesting mask, looks like to do with chat ^ Player.java:1212: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player public void appendDirUpdate2(stream str) { ^ Player.java:1216: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player public void appendDirUpdate(stream str) { ^ PlayerHandler.java:242: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class PlayerHandler public void updateNPC(Player plr, stream str) { ^ PlayerHandler.java:292: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class PlayerHandler private stream updateBlock = new stream(new byte[10000]); ^ PlayerHandler.java:294: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class PlayerHandler public void updatePlayer(Player plr, stream str) { ^ client.java:9080: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class client public stream inStream = null, outStream = null; ^ Player.java:695: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class Player playerProps = new stream(new byte[100]); ^ PlayerHandler.java:292: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class PlayerHandler private stream updateBlock = new stream(new byte[10000]); ^ client.java:9102: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class client outStream = new stream(new byte[bufferSize]); ^ client.java:9104: cannot find symbol symbol : class stream location: class client inStream = new stream(new byte[bufferSize]); ^ client.java:21811: incompatible types found : java.lang.String required: int somejunk = inStream.readUnsignedByte()+inStream.readUnsignedByte(); ^ 38 errors sh-2.05b$

item.title: Moparscape's built-in server. {Question for Mopar, himself, perhaps?}
item.dc:creator: @Oh_Noes_PIERATS Oh Noes! PIERATS!
item.description:
@Oh_Noes_PIERATS wrote:

If you an run moparscape client u can run any precompiled server.
Mac osX comes with java and jdk preinstalled so you should be able to compile it fairly easilly. Ill get the compile code for a mac give me 1 min

It turns out mac even has your class paths set up!

.sh scripts (apple macs and linux’s .bat equivelent)

Compiling:

#!/bin/sh javac *.java

Running:

#!/bin/sh Java server
The runing varies per server so open the .bat that comes with the server and copy the java line into you .sh if it is different.

Read full topic
item.source: Moparscape's built-in server. {Question for Mopar, himself, perhaps?}
